title: Gallery Activity: Ancient Artwork, Modern Technology—Seeing Roman Sculpture with 3-D Scanning
short_description: Join artist Anneli Goeller and museum educator Sam Ramos to uniquely connect with ancient Roman sculpture using 3-D scanning techniques and augmented reality.
description:
Join artist Anneli Goeller and museum educator Sam Ramos to uniquely connect with ancient Roman sculpture using 3-D scanning techniques and augmented reality (AR). With hands-on demonstrations of 3-D scanning and AR technologies, you'll be able to take a piece of Ancient Rome with you wherever you go.

All are welcome to join regardless of tech knowledge or capacity.

Limited iPads are available for those who want to scan objects in the galleries. If you'd like to view AR images and scan artworks on your own device, we invite you to bring a smartphone or tablet with the following specifications.

To view AR images:

  • iPhone or iPad: iOS12 or later can access USDZ files without any external apps. Older iPhones with updated software will work just fine.
  • Android: Android 8.0+ smartphone and tablets with AR Core 1.9 support can access GLTF files without any external apps.

To scan artworks:

  • Purchase and download the Polycam app through the App Store or Google Play. The app offers a 7-day free trial, 1 Month for $14.99, or 12 Months for $79.99.

Note that these specifications are most applicable to those who want to engage in the hands-on portion of the workshop. 

Anneli Goeller is an artist and poet who uses 3-D simulation to consider how personhood expands with the creation of algorithmic selves. They received their MFA in Film, Video, New Media, Animation at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and have been exhibited internationally in physical and virtual spaces including the Sheila C. Johnson Design Center and Jane Lombard Gallery in New York, Mana Contemporary in Chicago, the Freie Universitat Berlin, the wrong biennale, and the Chicago Virtual Art Museum. They are a lecturer at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.
